item.title: Tropical Storm Debby is approaching Florida
item.description: Tropical storm warnings and a hurricane watch were issued for the west coast of Florida and the panhandle as Debby crossed the Gulf of Mexico. Heavy rains are expected across the Southeast.

item.title: Nervous about making a speech? Life Kit can help
item.description: It can be anxiety-inducing to deliver a speech in front of an audience. NPR's Life Kit talks with a speechwriter and a speech coach to get their best tips for public speaking.

item.title: Israel and Hezbollah are on the brink of war. This isn't the first time
item.description: Israel and Hezbollah fought brief wars in 1996 and 2006. Both times, Israel thought it would teach Hezbollah a quick and painful lesson. Yet that didn’t happen. Now there’s the possibility of a third round, and Hezbollah has more firepower than ever.

item.title: In a league of his own, shot-putter Ryan Crouser wins U.S. 3rd Olympic gold in a row
item.description: The world record holder out-threw his opponents under a steady rain at Stade de France, becoming the first-ever shot-putter to win three Olympic gold medals.
